article.headline: Boston U. 73, Stony Brook 65
article.story: STONY BROOK, N.Y. (AP) -- Tony Gaffney scored a game-high 20 points and Boston University snapped a four-game losing streak with a 73-65 victory over Stony Brook on Thursday night. Corey Hassan followed with 16 points for the Terriers (6-11, 3-3 America East) and Brian Macon added 13. Mitchell Beauford scored 18 points to lead the Seawolves (3-13, 1-5), who lost their third straight. Mike Popoko added 16 points and a game-high 12 rebounds. Tre Cunningham scored five points in a 14-3 run that gave the Seawolves a 47-45 lead at 11:09. After four lead changes and two ties, Gaffney gave the Terriers the lead for good, 55-54, with two free throws at 7:14. That started a 12-4 run that built BU's lead to 67-58 at 1:40. After Anthony Noble's jumper gave Stony Brook a 10-9 lead at 13:09 of the first half, Hassan and Gaffney each had five points in an 18-8 run that put the Terriers ahead 27-18 about 8½ minutes later. Bobby Santiago hit a 3-pointer and Beauford had a jumper to pull Stony Brook to within 31-29 in the first minute of the second half. However, Macon scored five points to lead a 12-4 surge that built BU's lead to 43-33.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
